intro: Noisettia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco walnut, is a small, deciduous tree native to the Orinoco River basin in South America. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, aggregate fruits. The plant is notable for its hard, oily seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of edible oil. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological and economic systems of its native habitat.
